data.title: Change RA grenadier UI ordering
data.body: Closes #11317

data.title: Polish gdi06 commando behaviour
data.body:
- Make bridges invulnerable
- Remove abillity to attach c4 on bridges (Can get you stuck right at the beginning)
- Disable AttackMove on hard difficulty (We've disabled AutoTarget on hard)

data.title: Some TD polishing
data.body:
- Polished shellmap (see commit for details)
- Polished Gunboat missile (see commit for details) and turn speeds
- Polished Gunboat and turrets on GDI01
- Fixed infantry death animations for `BulletDeath` and added `RippedApartDeath` (used by dinos)

data.title: Make TS not load unnecessary mix files
data.body:
- gmenu.mix only contains the menu orverride from Patch 2.0/Firestorm
- maps0*.mix only contain singleplayer maps 
- multi.mix only contains multiplayer maps
- patch.mix only contains ini files.

None of these are used or even usable directly by OpenRA as-is, so it's pointless to load them.

data.title: Make mod.yaml read all yamls in a folder if * is used
data.body:
I've had this thought months ago, but forgot to open a ticket.

Basically, in addition to loading explicitly listed files, also allow this:

```
Rules:
    ra|rules/*.yaml
    rax|expansion/*-rules.yaml

Sequences:
    ra|sequences/*.yaml
    rax|expansion/*-sequences.yaml

Weapons:
    ra|weapons/*.yaml
    rax|expansion/*-weapons.yaml

ChromeLayout:
    ra|chrome/*.yaml
```

Advantages:
- mod.yaml is slimmed down
- mod.yaml is easier to maintain
- it becomes easier to add or remove yaml files quickly

data.title: OpenRA.Utility.exe giving me some problems when trying to --remap
data.body:
I'm trying to convert a sprite from CNC to RA so I don't have to use two different palletes for buildings. Right now I'm stuck at the beggining cause I don't know how to quite use this utility.

This is whats writen in the docs of utility:

`--remap SRCMOD:PAL DESTMOD:PAL SRCSHP DESTSHP`

So I have tried bunch of stuff:

`mono OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --remap cnc:temperat ra:temperat pyle.shp pyle-ra.shp`
`mono OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --remap cnc:chrome ra:chrome pyle.shp pyle-ra.shp`

getting pal from files in Uility.exe directory:

`mono OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --remap cnc:temperat_cnc.pal ra:temperat_ra.pal pyle.shp pyle-ra.shp`

Then someone on IRC, namely reaperrr, pointed out that temperat is not remapable palete and that I shoud use player insted.

`mono OpenRA.Utility.exe ra --remap cnc:player ra:player pyle.shp pyle-ra.shp`

And now with every command I get same error:

```
Unhandled Exception:
System.InvalidOperationException: TypeDictionary does not contain instance of type `OpenRA.Traits.PlayerColorPaletteInfo`
  at OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary.Get (System.Type t, Boolean throwsIfMissing) <0x40704ea0 + 0x000f7> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary.Get[T] () <0x40734000 + 0x0002b> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.ActorInfo.TraitInfo[T] () <0x40733fb0 + 0x00033> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.RemapShpCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) <0x4070a8c0 + 0x001df> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x40679230 + 0x005de> in <filename unknown>:0
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.InvalidOperationException: TypeDictionary does not contain instance of type `OpenRA.Traits.PlayerColorPaletteInfo`
  at OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary.Get (System.Type t, Boolean throwsIfMissing) <0x40704ea0 + 0x000f7> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Primitives.TypeDictionary.Get[T] () <0x40734000 + 0x0002b> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.ActorInfo.TraitInfo[T] () <0x40733fb0 + 0x00033> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.UtilityCommands.RemapShpCommand.Run (OpenRA.ModData modData, System.String[] args) <0x4070a8c0 + 0x001df> in <filename unknown>:0
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) <0x40679230 + 0x005de> in <filename unknown>:0
```

Unfortunatly I don't know what I'm doing wrong and where to check how utility trully work correctly. Any help would be appriciated.

data.title: Gobbled rendering with AMD Radeon Graphics
data.body:
Hello, 
I started up the game for this first time on a seperate computer which is not older then a year. 
My game ended up having a "seizure". 
![remove](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19477553/15406229/e674ed88-1e05-11e6-8af5-588853189d7b.png)
After booting it up again it still has the "seizure". 
I did tab out for a bit but my mouse went missing during the "seizure" and I was unable to 
quit the game by any normal means.
The mouse is premamently gone after booting it up a third time. 

After reinstalling it I still have a problem with the "seizure" going on. 
I attempted to start a game and the problem is still all over the screen.
My mouse was however working fine, only tabbing out once.

EDIT: I use Windows 7 with a system type of 64-bit operating system. My graphics card is _AMD Radeon Graphics Processor_.

Cheers,
-kiroxsu

data.title: Sliding Husks don't kill infantry
data.body:
In a stream by SoScared Ive noticed that sliding Husks do not squash infantry. When a driving tank is killed it slides under the infantry and the infantry stays on top. I think it should either be killed or flee off it.

See it happening here: https://www.twitch.tv/soscared/v/65489414
At: 24:50

data.title: When spectating teamgames the hotkey to switch view doesn't seem to work
data.body:
Just now I spectated a teamgame. Normally in a 1v1 I use a hotkey (0) to switch views. For 1v1s this works just fine. For teamgames this seems not to work and I have to manually select the team from the dropdown menu.

Also in the settings menu under Input - Observer menu there is no place where you can assign a key to "switch team view". There is for the "-" (all players) and "=" (disable shroud), but not for the 0.

data.title: Odd "Restart Mission" Menu button placement
data.body:
This is a little thing, and I seem to recall it was kind like this originally, but the "Restart Mission" button should be front and center of a mission failure screen.  It was jarring enough where I spent a minute or two clicking things at random, looking...

Right now, it's like this:
I just _eat it_, Tanya walks in front of a Tesla coil, and dies.  Dang.  I want to restart, but the screen looks like this.
![where](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3222168/15381131/602c3c0e-1d42-11e6-97e7-331b8f710ce5.png)

After looking and looking, I just say screw it, and quit.  Lo and Behold.
![oh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3222168/15381143/7df4f69a-1d42-11e6-92b7-6a7800557b8e.png)

Personally, I think it could be better.

data.title: Equalize Soviet and Allies 'infantry' tab by moving the grenadier, for easier hotkey configuration.
data.body:
With the same rationale as #8973  this suggest the grenadier be moved to slot 3:

![infantry tab](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/15378973/938c695e-1d68-11e6-85a8-0d43c1ef4c12.png)

It's gonna make training infantry more convenient with the same function keys for rifle and rocket infantry. In RA, grenadiers are built on occasion, and seldom as part of a unit composition.

data.title: Add Scott's Allies02 multiplayer mission as "Evacuation"
Gas bomb idea for Red Alert
data.body:
This might be a bit ambitious for me (toyed around with the idea for a few hours, couldn't figure it out), but I just wanted to throw out an idea:

A chemical weapon- mustard gas, basically. The thought was to basically have a badger drop a bomb that detonates to create a Tiberium-like zone (minus the visceroid transformation). Graphically, nothing ambitious, just an explosion followed by the playersmoke animation.

I attempted to the bomb paradrop as a "vehicle" which can be deployed to detonate like the demolition truck, thus creating the smoke.

Has anyone tried something similar to that already? If so, I'd like to play around with it to see how it was done.

data.title: Revamp custom build times.
data.body:
Removed the `CustomBuildTimeValue` trait, shifted it's properties to `Buildable`, renamed `ProductionQueue.BuildSpeed` to `BuildDurationMultiplier` for consistency.

IMO it's more-modderfriendly to specify a multiplier on the cost-based value than to specify arbitrary, non-scalable/inheritable constants.

data.title: Fix IsMoving returning false when activity is a MovePart-derivative
data.body: If it works as intended, it should fix #11304.

data.title: "Reverses" in yaml throws IndexOutOfRangeException in D2K
data.body:
In bleed Dune 2000 mod, on an actor which can change facing, adding `Reverses: True` alongside `Transpose: True` throws an IndexOutOfRangeException in `DefaultSpriteSequence.GetSprite`, on the line: `return sprites[Frames[i]];`

This was tested using the ornithopter. In this case, `sprites` was of length 4841, `Frames` was of length 4, and `i` had the value of 32.

data.title: Add nod09
data.body:
Add nod09 - "Reinforce Egypt"
http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Reinforce_Egypt

data.title: AI doesn't deploy replacement MCV
data.body: After destroying the AI's conyard in bleed d2k, its remaining two MCVs continued to path across the map from one buildable area to the next, without ever deploying either MCV. The cause of this appears to be that ActorExtensionsForMove.IsMoving doesn't detect MovePart moves (MoveFirstHalf and MoveSecondHalf), resulting in new location orders regularly being appended to the units' queues. While debugging, there were just under 2000 Move orders queued for one of the MCVs.

data.title: IsMoving is returning false for actors who are performing a MoveFirstHalf or MoveSecondHalf
data.body:
> [21:28] pizzaoverhead Hi, I think I've spotted a bug with ActorExtensionsForMove.IsMoving
> [21:29] pizzaoverhead An AI without a conyard is driving an MCV from place to place without deploying, repeatedly checking whether IsMoving before changing its planned build location.
> [21:30] pizzaoverhead IsMoving is returning false for actors who are performing a "MoveFirstHalf" or "MoveSecondHalf"

Might also be the underlying issue of #11112 leaving strange "gaps" when turning, same for actors "WithMoveAnimation" sometimes restarting the animation while moving.

data.title: Add generic tooltip name for td ships
data.body: Changes the generic display name for TD Ships to "Enemy Ship". (Previously "Enemy").

data.title: Add ship explosions to td mod
data.body:
Ships are a common enemy in later nod missions, this pr is adding an explosion effect for them... based on how it got implemented for ra.
This will also enable smoke effects and explosions for the hovercraft, which can be build in debug mode.

As discussed in #11283

data.title: Added OpenRA.Mods.RA2.dll
data.body: This just moves the existing source code files to ease repository setup and reuse. The mod rules and configuration stays at https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/
